title: Deep Spectral Methods for Unsupervised Ultrasound Image Interpretation
abstract: arXiv:2408.02043v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Ultrasound imaging is challenging to interpret due to non-uniform intensities, low contrast, and inherent artifacts, necessitating extensive training for non-specialists. Advanced representation with clear tissue structure separation could greatly assist clinicians in mapping underlying anatomy and distinguishing between tissue layers. Decomposing an image into semantically meaningful segments is mainly achieved using supervised segmentation algorithms. Unsupervised methods are beneficial, as acquiring large labeled datasets is difficult and costly, but despite their advantages, they still need to be explored in ultrasound. This paper proposes a novel unsupervised deep learning strategy tailored to ultrasound to obtain easily interpretable tissue separations. tldr: 本研究提出了一种新型无监督深度学习策略，能用于超声图像的无监督分割，该方法无需标签数据即可获得高的组织分离质量，为临床肿瘤病灶检测和诊断提供了有效工具。
